features: Produce a Grilled/Crispy effect: When you grill and cook with MACONEE , the microwave is converted into far-infrared heat by patented thermal material technology under the grill pan. It functions similarly to a professional infrared grill. The material also has micro shield technology to keep microwaves out and grill-heated juices and flavors in for great tasting results!

Fast quick and easy: with the MACONEE microwave grilled cheese maker you can create a delicious grilled cheese sandwich in your microwave in minutes with less mess than conventional cooking methods. at home, in the RV, in the College Dorm, in the office, at the Tailgate Party, anywhere you own a microwave!
Multifunction: you can use it for toasted sandwiches, paninis, burgers, and franks sausage. also can be used to reheat left-over with crispy or grill effect
Easy to Clean up: microwave sandwich maker Cooking surface is non-stick-making clean-up easy, Dishwasher Safe, all the pieces fit comforably in the dishwasher.

The MACONEE microwave panini press converts microwave heat into far-infrared heat during cooking, which results in a delicious Grilled/Crispy effect, but it also causes the cookware to become extremely hot. When removing cookware from the microwave, we strongly advise using an oven mitt.
body.description: How does the Maconee microwave sandwich maker achieve a grilled/crispy effect in the microwave? Toaster, Stove & Oven like results Maconee microwave sandwich maker utilizes advanced thermal material technology, which allows both the bottom and top metal plates to heat up rapidly. This technology enables users to create perfectly toasted sandwiches, quesadillas, melts, and grill burger patties, chicken breast, sausage, and more quickly and easily with the metal plates' heat in the microwave, just like using a toaster or stove and oven. Thermal material technology The top and bottom metal plates heat up rapidly Toast and sizzle up foods with the metal plates' heat Toaster, Stove & Oven like results Toasted sandwiches, grilled cheese, grilled burger patties, hotdogs, and much more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Upgrade Your Microwave Cooking with Maconee! If you love the convenience of a microwave but hate its limitations on cooking, Maconee has the perfect solution for you. Our thermal material technology transforms your microwave into a powerful far-infrared heating machine, enabling you to cook like a pro with the heat of a pan. It's like having a mini oven in your microwave that allows you to achieve oven and stove-like results without the hassle and time-consuming processes of traditional cooking methods. How does the Maconee microwave sandwich maker achieve a grilled/crispy effect in the microwave? Toaster, Stove & Oven like results Maconee microwave sandwich maker utilizes advanced thermal material technology, which allows both the bottom and top metal plates to heat up rapidly. This technology enables users to create perfectly toasted sandwiches, quesadillas, melts, and grill burger patties, chicken breast, sausage, and more quickly and easily with the metal plates' heat in the microwave, just like using a toaster or stove and oven. Thermal material technology The top and bottom metal plates heat up rapidly Toast and sizzle up foods with the metal plates' heat Toaster, Stove & Oven like results Toasted sandwiches, grilled cheese, grilled burger patties, hotdogs, and much more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised
reviews.reviewText: I have only used the Microwave Sandwich Maker twice. I am very pleased with the results. It works as advertised. I have a LG 1000 watt microwave, so I decreased the cooking time on each side to 90 seconds instead of the two minutes as suggested in the directions. The directions are apparently written for a 900 watt microwave. I followed the advice of some of the reviewers. I preheated the Microwave Sandwich Maker for 2 minutes on high. I then placed the sandwich in the Microwave Sandwich Maker and cooked it according to the directions for both sides. The result gave me a very nicely toasted sandwich. I even added meat to the second sandwich.A few reviewers lamented the panini marks left by the heating places. Though I have not tried it, I would suggest turning the heating plates over which would most likely satisfy most users. Personally, I found nothing wrong with the grate indentations/marks left by the Microwave Sandwich Maker.I placed Microwave Sandwich Maker in the dishwasher and it came out nice and clean. For a thorough cleaning, remove the silicone holders from the heating plates before washing. They go back on quite easily.The only criticism I would make is not of the Microwave Sandwich Maker itself, but of the directions that are provided with it. They are very limited and over simplified. No mention is made of preheating the Microwave Sandwich Maker, which I think is an important step. Do be aware that once heated in the microwave, the Microwave Sandwich Maker is HOT!Important Note: As I stated previously, I have only used the Microwave Sandwich Maker twice. If I discover problems later, then I will revise my review accordingly. At this time, I am sold on the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Makes a great grilled ham & cheese.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for normal sized square bread
reviews.reviewText: 2 complaints: This doesn't work perfectly for rectangular "gourmet" wider pre-sliced bread since it is only "normal bread" sized, but it's still okay for that. Also, I was hoping there was a "flat" side to the plates that doesn't have "grill mark" ridges but that isn't the case. For regular cheap sandwich bread and smaller it works great. My wife likes to make grilled cheese with about twice the normal thickness of cheese on gluten-free bread, which doesn't seem to conduct heat as well as normal bread. This works perfect for that. Overall, pretty good. One other thing, you pretty much have to disassemble to wash in the dishwasher, which isn't hard, then shake the water out of the crevices afterward.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sadly, this won't replace your frying/grilling pan
reviews.reviewText: At first, I loved the panini references and pictures. But after using it several times, I'm not sure that I'm a big fan. Unlike a frying pan, which grills just the outer few millimeters of the bread leaving the inner portion moist and soft, this unit dries out the whole bread. There is no "moist and soft" interior part. It's all dried out. You can go from undercooked to brick in just a few seconds. As an experiment with my son, we made 2 cheese sandwiches. We used the same bread, the same cheese, at room temperature, and with both slices of bread prepped with butter. One sandwich we cooked the traditional way, in a frying pan, and with the second we used this Sandwich Maker. We adhered to the manufacturer's instructions throughout the whole experiment. The results weren't even close. The sandwich that was grilled in the frying pan was cooked to a golden brown (although no panini grill marks), the cheese was perfectly melted, and the sandwich was moist with a buttery taste. The Panini Sandwich Maker, on the other hand, was dry as can be and had us reaching for milk/water with every bite. More importantly, there was no buttery taste and no sense of "crust on the outside and moist melted cheese on the inside." It was not pleasant. All we could taste was crunchy, dried out bread with a hint of dried out cheese. It should be noted that we tried this experiment twice. The first time at the recommended microwave time of 2 minutes per side, and the second, shaving 30 seconds off each side, of 1.5 minutes each side. The only difference was that the 2 minute/side was darker. Other than that, the dryness, dehydration, and loss of flavor was the same. I would LOVE a microwave product that truly replicates the ooey-gooeyness of a good grilled sandwich, but this product missed the mark by a lot. I will not purchase another one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Microwave sandwich maker
reviews.reviewText: I love this item. I use it to make several different types of sandwiches. I highly recommend using a paper plate under the sandwich maker to collect any dripping and to make cleaning up easier. I make hamburgers from frozen and cook for less than 4 minutes depending on the size and weight of the burger. Burger comes out cooked and very juicy. Burger is NOT dry like I expected it to be. Note that the press gets very hot so be extra careful when removing it from the microwave. Highly recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Things like chicken nuggets and wontons get soggy when heated in the microwave. This device makes them hot and crispy. Vegetables like asparagus and mushrooms get soggy when heated in the microwave. This device gives them grill marks and keeps the vegetables firm. The microwaves themselves do not penetrate the metal plate, therefore, the food inside is only heated by the plates themselves, and not by microwaves. This might mean two or more minutes longer, but the results are worth it. In the time it takes to heat a frying pan to do the same job, you can get crispy and healthy food. The small version is small - good for portion control. But you need the larger version if you feed more than yourself. This is an excellent buy.
Idéal pour une personne seule, étonnant de pouvoir griller au micro onde, un petit livre de recettes en français aurait été intéressant

reviews.reviewTitle: Yeah it grills but not as the advertising says
reviews.reviewText: The grill plates are not as reliable to grill the bread as is stated in the promotions..If the filling of the sandwich is not moist then the sandwich dries out before it gets properly grilled.Need to modify the grilling alloy to get a lot hotter.
Pretty good- one side of the sandwich gets more cooked than the other. Good for doing a couple of slices of bacon
